**Is this a BUG REPORT or FEATURE REQUEST?**:

/kind bug


**What happened**:

In [client-go](https://github.com/kubernetes/kubernetes/blob/master/staging/src/k8s.io/client-go/util/homedir/homedir.go), which is used by many clients, homedir favors a concatenation of %HOMEDRIVE% and %HOMEPATH% over %USERPROFILE%

**What you expected to happen**:

HOME should be favored if it is set, then fallback to USERPROFILE, then maybe HOMEDRIVE and HOMEPATH combination.

**Anything else we need to know?**:

The current implementation of https://github.com/kubernetes/client-go/blob/master/util/homedir/homedir.go resolves a homedir in this order:

1. HOME
2. a concatenation of HOMEDRIVE and HOMEPATH
3. USERPROFILE

I believe that this is wrong, notably the HOMEDRIVE and HOMEPATH construct.

In the corporate environment where I work, these variables are hard set to network drives which are not writable. This results in many problems for dependant projects like minikube, kubectl kubernetes/kubectl#227 (which would benefit from using client-go code).

There are almost no mention of using HOMEDRIVE and HOMEPATH, but authoritative information on the subject is hard to find.

Relevant documentation: 

https://stackoverflow.com/questions/606483/what-is-the-meaning-of-these-windows-environment-variables-homedrive-homepath/648265#648265

https://blogs.msdn.microsoft.com/patricka/2010/03/18/where-should-i-store-my-data-and-configuration-files-if-i-target-multiple-os-versions/



**Environment**:

- Windows
